author: 0xalizk
content: who's doing the "update" in the quoted sentence above?

author: sky.cactus
content: At the moment, I believe most (all?) Ethereum mining clients just hard-code the miner fee.

author: sky.cactus
content: The idea would be to update the clients so they utilize a smarter algorithm.

author: sky.cactus
content: At the moment, blocks are full with transactions at 40 nanoeth gas price sitting in the pending queue.  Miners should be willing to risk bigger blocks (which means more uncles) in exchange for 40 nanoeth per gas, but their mining software is dumb and is throwing away free money because they just have a hard-coded gas price and block size.

author: sky.cactus
content: Also, individual miners cannot choose different block sizes, it is just a majority "vote" for block size, which is just humans weighted by hashpower making arbitrary decisions.
